results.title: Ground water
results.brief_description: A study of ground water; the following aspects are dealt with in detail: the funtion of water in changing the face of the earth in producing spectacular geological phenomena, and its vital importance to man; artesian systems, springs, wells, water tables, caves; such spectacular phenomena as geysers, roaring springs, hot springs, sink holes, petrification, geode fillings, and the concentration of minerals. Below the surface of the earth, often unknown to man, water works many transformations. Both animation and direct photography of well-known examples of these various phenomena, many of them famous as tourist attractions in USA are presented in this film.

results.title: Ground water
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 21 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Groundwater is the accumulation of water which seeps through cracks, fissures and faults into the earth and collects in a large quantity beneath the surface. Many continents have large water tables which are accessed through wells and bores. Groundwater seeping through limestone helps form stalectites and stalecmites in caves. Groundwater contamination presents serious health risks therefore geologists who study the movement of water play an important role in assessing potential risks.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television

results.title: Ground rules
results.creator_credit: Anne Whitehead, Barry Pierce and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Maps and Map Reading”.
An introductory segment that sets out to establish a broad understanding of the use of and need for maps and map reading skills. Three situations are illustrated: an ambulance attending an accident, a car rally navigator planning his route, and two tourists who are hopelessly lost on a back road.

results.title: Grott
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Neil Robinson
results.brief_description: An auto-aesthetic analysis of the conceptual indeterminacy of the slides-of-our-holiday genre, probing the Milesian paranomasia inherent in the aetiology of the medium, specifically, (a)where are we going? (b)what does it all mean? (c)who are all these people?

results.title: Groove squad [DVD]
results.brief_description: In this animated feature, three exuberant teenage friends, Chrissie, Ping and Mac, are ambitious cheerleaders and students at Bay City High School. After a freak accident, and much to their delight, they are transformed into super-heroes obtaining the skills, respectively, of extraordinary strength, X-ray vision and flying. Joining the dynamic trio in their quest to combat the evil-doings of various villains is Adrian, their funky hairdresser and Zeke, a boy who nurses a serious crush on Ping. The girls however don’t neglect their cheerleading duties but continue to practise their rigorous routines in readiness for the Bay City cheerleading championships. As head cheerleader, Chrissie is frequently in conflict with her colleague, Star, a wealthy girl who covets Chrissie’s status. As the Groove squad learn to comprehend the extent of their powers (which come and go, not always at their behest) they learn the value of working as a team in the spirit of friendship. This film, suitable for children and pitched at teens and pre-teens, has an endearing comic tone that supports the neo-feminist values of ‘girl power’.

results.title: Grizzly
results.creator_credit: BBC, Discovery Channel, Sue Turner, Jeff Turner, Patrick Morris and Neil Nightingale
results.brief_description: The Grizzly bear is the world’s largest carnivore. Weighing up to 1,000 lbs, they can run as fast as a racehorse. They’re smart, they’re resourceful and they’re very dangerous. Presented by David Attenborough, this video is the story of Jeff Turner, a nature cameraman who has spent the best part of the last 15 years filming Grizzly bears in their natural state in the coastal rainforests of western Canada. Because he understands the nature of the bears so well, he is able to get closer to them than ever before and it is this intimate footage which makes this documentary so special.

results.title: Gristle
results.creator_credit: Ernest Films, Carolyn-Johnson Films, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Carolyn Johnson and Andrew Murray
results.brief_description: Two animal transport workers from the company Flying Animals (Rhys Muldoon and Darren Gilshenan) find themselves in possession of a dead cat called Gristle - a certain blot on Doug’s perfect record which could impede future promotions.

results.title: Grip and stance
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the position of the hands on a golf club shaft and shows how finger placement on a club is importance id directing each golf shot. Diagrams the placement of the feet in relationship to the ball and discusses the probable results of shot made from different stances. Inclines demonstrations by Tommy Armour ins stop motion and slow motion photography.

results.title: Grimm's fairy tales. Volume 2
results.brief_description: Presented by Noni Hazelhurst, each of the Grimms fairy tales is brought to life by the use of beautifully illustrated full colour drawings of both the characters and their environment. The stories told in this volume are: Tom Thumb (16 minutes) ; Snowdrop/Snow White (16 minutes) ; Little Red Riding Hood (9 minutes); “Rumpelstiltskin (8 minutes). Each story has been divided into its own segment so the educator can easily find stories that suit individual teaching needs. This tape is not intended to be used for entertainment only.
